1713 | - Add tooltips to make what buttons do more obvious

1721 | - Add slider to control max output tokens for thinking models

1724 |

1726 | - Fix various issues with the model picker (thanks @System233!)
1727 | - Fix model input / output cost parsing (thanks @System233!)
1728 | - Add drag-and-drop for files

1742 | - Fix sliding window calculations for Sonnet 3.7 that were causing a context window overflow (thanks @cte!)
1743 | - Encourage diff editing more strongly in the system prompt (thanks @hannesrudolph!)
1744 | 
1745 | ## [3.7.1] - 2025-02-24

1748 | 
1749 | ## [3.7.0] - 2025-02-24
1750 | 
1751 | - Introducing Roo Code 3.7, with support for the new Claude Sonnet 3.7. Because who cares about skipping version numbers anymore? Thanks @lupuletic and @cte for the PRs!
1752 | 
1753 | ## [3.3.26] - 2025-02-27
1754 |

1773 | 
1774 | - Improve the Provider Settings configuration with clear Save buttons and warnings about unsaved changes (thanks @System233!)

1970 | ## [3.2.0 - 3.2.2]
1971 | 
1972 | - **Name Change From Roo Cline to Roo Code:** We're excited to announce our new name! After growing beyond 50,000 installations, we've rebranded from Roo Cline to Roo Code to better reflect our identity as we chart our own course.
1973 | 
1974 | - **Custom Modes:** Create your own personas for Roo Code! While our built-in modes (Code, Architect, Ask) are still here, you can now shape entirely new ones:
1975 |     - Define custom prompts
1976 |     - Choose which tools each mode can access
1977 |     - Create specialized assistants for any workflow
1978 |     - Just type "Create a new mode for <X>" or visit the Prompts tab in the top menu to get started
1979 | 
1980 | Join us at https://www.reddit.com/r/RooCode to share your custom modes and be part of our next chapter!

 397 | 	// When the task is completed, the top instance is removed, reactivating the
 398 | 	// previous task.
 399 | 	async addClineToStack(task: Task) {
 400 | 		// Add this cline instance into the stack that represents the order of
 401 | 		// all the called tasks.
 402 | 		this.clineStack.push(task)
 403 | 		task.emit(RooCodeEventName.TaskFocused)
 404 | 
 405 | 		// Perform special setup provider specific tasks.
 406 | 		await this.performPreparationTasks(task)
 407 | 
 408 | 		// Ensure getState() resolves correctly.
 409 | 		const state = await this.getState()
 410 | 
 411 | 		if (!state || typeof state.mode !== "string") {
 412 | 			throw new Error(t("common:errors.retrieve_current_mode"))
 413 | 		}
 414 | 	}
 415 | 
 416 | 	async performPreparationTasks(cline: Task) {
 417 | 		// LMStudio: We need to force model loading in order to read its context
 418 | 		// size; we do it now since we're starting a task with that model selected.
 419 | 		if (cline.apiConfiguration && cline.apiConfiguration.apiProvider === "lmstudio") {
 420 | 			try {
 421 | 				if (!hasLoadedFullDetails(cline.apiConfiguration.lmStudioModelId!)) {
 422 | 					await forceFullModelDetailsLoad(
 423 | 						cline.apiConfiguration.lmStudioBaseUrl ?? "http://localhost:1234",
 424 | 						cline.apiConfiguration.lmStudioModelId!,
 425 | 					)
 426 | 				}
 427 | 			} catch (error) {
 428 | 				this.log(`Failed to load full model details for LM Studio: ${error}`)
 429 | 				vscode.window.showErrorMessage(error.message)
 430 | 			}
 431 | 		}
 432 | 	}
 433 | 
 434 | 	// Removes and destroys the top Cline instance (the current finished task),
 435 | 	// activating the previous one (resuming the parent task).
 436 | 	async removeClineFromStack() {
 437 | 		if (this.clineStack.length === 0) {
 438 | 			return
 439 | 		}
 440 | 
 441 | 		// Pop the top Cline instance from the stack.
 442 | 		let task = this.clineStack.pop()
 443 | 
 444 | 		if (task) {
 445 | 			task.emit(RooCodeEventName.TaskUnfocused)
 446 | 
 447 | 			try {
 448 | 				// Abort the running task and set isAbandoned to true so
 449 | 				// all running promises will exit as well.
 450 | 				await task.abortTask(true)
 451 | 			} catch (e) {
 452 | 				this.log(
 453 | 					`[ClineProvider#removeClineFromStack] abortTask() failed ${task.taskId}.${task.instanceId}: ${e.message}`,
 454 | 				)
 455 | 			}
 456 | 
 457 | 			// Remove event listeners before clearing the reference.
 458 | 			const cleanupFunctions = this.taskEventListeners.get(task)
 459 | 
 460 | 			if (cleanupFunctions) {
 461 | 				cleanupFunctions.forEach((cleanup) => cleanup())
 462 | 				this.taskEventListeners.delete(task)
 463 | 			}
 464 | 
 465 | 			// Make sure no reference kept, once promises end it will be
 466 | 			// garbage collected.
 467 | 			task = undefined
 468 | 		}
 469 | 	}
 470 | 
 471 | 	getTaskStackSize(): number {
 472 | 		return this.clineStack.length
 473 | 	}
 474 | 
 475 | 	public getCurrentTaskStack(): string[] {
 476 | 		return this.clineStack.map((cline) => cline.taskId)
 477 | 	}
 478 | 
 479 | 	// Remove the current task/cline instance (at the top of the stack), so this
 480 | 	// task is finished and resume the previous task/cline instance (if it
 481 | 	// exists).
 482 | 	// This is used when a subtask is finished and the parent task needs to be
 483 | 	// resumed.
 484 | 	async finishSubTask(lastMessage: string) {
 485 | 		// Remove the last cline instance from the stack (this is the finished
 486 | 		// subtask).
 487 | 		await this.removeClineFromStack()
 488 | 		// Resume the last cline instance in the stack (if it exists - this is
 489 | 		// the 'parent' calling task).
 490 | 		await this.getCurrentTask()?.completeSubtask(lastMessage)
 491 | 	}
 492 | 	// Pending Edit Operations Management
 493 | 
 494 | 	/**
 495 | 	 * Sets a pending edit operation with automatic timeout cleanup
 496 | 	 */
 497 | 	public setPendingEditOperation(
 498 | 		operationId: string,
 499 | 		editData: {
 500 | 			messageTs: number
 501 | 			editedContent: string
 502 | 			images?: string[]
 503 | 			messageIndex: number
 504 | 			apiConversationHistoryIndex: number
 505 | 		},
 506 | 	): void {
 507 | 		// Clear any existing operation with the same ID
 508 | 		this.clearPendingEditOperation(operationId)
 509 | 
 510 | 		// Create timeout for automatic cleanup
 511 | 		const timeoutId = setTimeout(() => {
 512 | 			this.clearPendingEditOperation(operationId)
 513 | 			this.log(`[setPendingEditOperation] Automatically cleared stale pending operation: ${operationId}`)
 514 | 		}, ClineProvider.PENDING_OPERATION_TIMEOUT_MS)
 515 | 
 516 | 		// Store the operation
 517 | 		this.pendingOperations.set(operationId, {
 518 | 			...editData,
 519 | 			timeoutId,
 520 | 			createdAt: Date.now(),
 521 | 		})
 522 | 
 523 | 		this.log(`[setPendingEditOperation] Set pending operation: ${operationId}`)
 524 | 	}
 525 | 
 526 | 	/**
 527 | 	 * Gets a pending edit operation by ID
 528 | 	 */
 529 | 	private getPendingEditOperation(operationId: string): PendingEditOperation | undefined {
 530 | 		return this.pendingOperations.get(operationId)
 531 | 	}
 532 | 
 533 | 	/**
 534 | 	 * Clears a specific pending edit operation
 535 | 	 */
 536 | 	private clearPendingEditOperation(operationId: string): boolean {
 537 | 		const operation = this.pendingOperations.get(operationId)
 538 | 		if (operation) {
 539 | 			clearTimeout(operation.timeoutId)
 540 | 			this.pendingOperations.delete(operationId)
 541 | 			this.log(`[clearPendingEditOperation] Cleared pending operation: ${operationId}`)
 542 | 			return true
 543 | 		}
 544 | 		return false
 545 | 	}
 546 | 
 547 | 	/**
 548 | 	 * Clears all pending edit operations
 549 | 	 */
 550 | 	private clearAllPendingEditOperations(): void {
 551 | 		for (const [operationId, operation] of this.pendingOperations) {
 552 | 			clearTimeout(operation.timeoutId)
 553 | 		}
 554 | 		this.pendingOperations.clear()
 555 | 		this.log(`[clearAllPendingEditOperations] Cleared all pending operations`)
 556 | 	}
 557 | 
 558 | 	/*
 559 | 	VSCode extensions use the disposable pattern to clean up resources when the sidebar/editor tab is closed by the user or system. This applies to event listening, commands, interacting with the UI, etc.
 560 | 	- https://vscode-docs.readthedocs.io/en/stable/extensions/patterns-and-principles/
 561 | 	- https://github.com/microsoft/vscode-extension-samples/blob/main/webview-sample/src/extension.ts
 562 | 	*/
 563 | 	private clearWebviewResources() {
 564 | 		while (this.webviewDisposables.length) {
 565 | 			const x = this.webviewDisposables.pop()
 566 | 			if (x) {
 567 | 				x.dispose()
 568 | 			}
 569 | 		}
 570 | 	}
 571 | 
 572 | 	async dispose() {
 573 | 		this.log("Disposing ClineProvider...")
 574 | 
 575 | 		// Clear all tasks from the stack.
 576 | 		while (this.clineStack.length > 0) {
 577 | 			await this.removeClineFromStack()
 578 | 		}
 579 | 
 580 | 		this.log("Cleared all tasks")
 581 | 
 582 | 		// Clear all pending edit operations to prevent memory leaks
 583 | 		this.clearAllPendingEditOperations()
 584 | 		this.log("Cleared pending operations")
 585 | 
 586 | 		if (this.view && "dispose" in this.view) {
 587 | 			this.view.dispose()
 588 | 			this.log("Disposed webview")
 589 | 		}
 590 | 
 591 | 		this.clearWebviewResources()
 592 | 
 593 | 		// Clean up cloud service event listener
 594 | 		if (CloudService.hasInstance()) {
 595 | 			CloudService.instance.off("settings-updated", this.handleCloudSettingsUpdate)
 596 | 		}
 597 | 
 598 | 		while (this.disposables.length) {
 599 | 			const x = this.disposables.pop()
 600 | 
 601 | 			if (x) {
 602 | 				x.dispose()
 603 | 			}
 604 | 		}
 605 | 
 606 | 		this._workspaceTracker?.dispose()
 607 | 		this._workspaceTracker = undefined
 608 | 		await this.mcpHub?.unregisterClient()
 609 | 		this.mcpHub = undefined
 610 | 		this.marketplaceManager?.cleanup()
 611 | 		this.customModesManager?.dispose()
 612 | 		this.log("Disposed all disposables")
 613 | 		ClineProvider.activeInstances.delete(this)
 614 | 
 615 | 		// Clean up any event listeners attached to this provider
 616 | 		this.removeAllListeners()
 617 | 
 618 | 		McpServerManager.unregisterProvider(this)
 619 | 	}
 620 | 
 621 | 	public static getVisibleInstance(): ClineProvider | undefined {
 622 | 		return findLast(Array.from(this.activeInstances), (instance) => instance.view?.visible === true)
 623 | 	}
 624 | 
 625 | 	public static async getInstance(): Promise<ClineProvider | undefined> {
 626 | 		let visibleProvider = ClineProvider.getVisibleInstance()
 627 | 
 628 | 		// If no visible provider, try to show the sidebar view
 629 | 		if (!visibleProvider) {
 630 | 			await vscode.commands.executeCommand(`${Package.name}.SidebarProvider.focus`)
 631 | 			// Wait briefly for the view to become visible
 632 | 			await delay(100)
 633 | 			visibleProvider = ClineProvider.getVisibleInstance()
 634 | 		}
 635 | 
 636 | 		// If still no visible provider, return
 637 | 		if (!visibleProvider) {
 638 | 			return
 639 | 		}
 640 | 
 641 | 		return visibleProvider
 642 | 	}
 643 | 
 644 | 	public static async isActiveTask(): Promise<boolean> {
 645 | 		const visibleProvider = await ClineProvider.getInstance()
 646 | 
 647 | 		if (!visibleProvider) {
 648 | 			return false
 649 | 		}
 650 | 
 651 | 		// Check if there is a cline instance in the stack (if this provider has an active task)
 652 | 		if (visibleProvider.getCurrentTask()) {
 653 | 			return true
 654 | 		}
 655 | 
 656 | 		return false
 657 | 	}

 659 | 	public static async handleCodeAction(
 660 | 		command: CodeActionId,
 661 | 		promptType: CodeActionName,
 662 | 		params: Record<string, string | any[]>,
 663 | 	): Promise<void> {
 664 | 		// Capture telemetry for code action usage
 665 | 		TelemetryService.instance.captureCodeActionUsed(promptType)
 666 | 
 667 | 		const visibleProvider = await ClineProvider.getInstance()
 668 | 
 669 | 		if (!visibleProvider) {
 670 | 			return
 671 | 		}
 672 | 
 673 | 		const { customSupportPrompts } = await visibleProvider.getState()
 674 | 
 675 | 		// TODO: Improve type safety for promptType.
 676 | 		const prompt = supportPrompt.create(promptType, params, customSupportPrompts)
 677 | 
 678 | 		if (command === "addToContext") {
 679 | 			await visibleProvider.postMessageToWebview({ type: "invoke", invoke: "setChatBoxMessage", text: prompt })
 680 | 			return
 681 | 		}
 682 | 
 683 | 		await visibleProvider.createTask(prompt)
 684 | 	}
 685 | 
 686 | 	public static async handleTerminalAction(
 687 | 		command: TerminalActionId,
 688 | 		promptType: TerminalActionPromptType,
 689 | 		params: Record<string, string | any[]>,
 690 | 	): Promise<void> {
 691 | 		TelemetryService.instance.captureCodeActionUsed(promptType)
 692 | 
 693 | 		const visibleProvider = await ClineProvider.getInstance()
 694 | 
 695 | 		if (!visibleProvider) {
 696 | 			return
 697 | 		}
 698 | 
 699 | 		const { customSupportPrompts } = await visibleProvider.getState()
 700 | 		const prompt = supportPrompt.create(promptType, params, customSupportPrompts)
 701 | 
 702 | 		if (command === "terminalAddToContext") {
 703 | 			await visibleProvider.postMessageToWebview({ type: "invoke", invoke: "setChatBoxMessage", text: prompt })
 704 | 			return
 705 | 		}
 706 | 
 707 | 		try {
 708 | 			await visibleProvider.createTask(prompt)
 709 | 		} catch (error) {
 710 | 			if (error instanceof OrganizationAllowListViolationError) {
 711 | 				// Errors from terminal commands seem to get swallowed / ignored.
 712 | 				vscode.window.showErrorMessage(error.message)
 713 | 			}
 714 | 
 715 | 			throw error
 716 | 		}
 717 | 	}

 719 | 	async resolveWebviewView(webviewView: vscode.WebviewView | vscode.WebviewPanel) {
 720 | 		this.view = webviewView
 721 | 		const inTabMode = "onDidChangeViewState" in webviewView
 722 | 
 723 | 		if (inTabMode) {
 724 | 			setPanel(webviewView, "tab")
 725 | 		} else if ("onDidChangeVisibility" in webviewView) {
 726 | 			setPanel(webviewView, "sidebar")
 727 | 		}
 728 | 
 729 | 		// Initialize out-of-scope variables that need to receive persistent
 730 | 		// global state values.
 731 | 		this.getState().then(
 732 | 			({
 733 | 				terminalShellIntegrationTimeout = Terminal.defaultShellIntegrationTimeout,
 734 | 				terminalShellIntegrationDisabled = false,
 735 | 				terminalCommandDelay = 0,
 736 | 				terminalZshClearEolMark = true,
 737 | 				terminalZshOhMy = false,
 738 | 				terminalZshP10k = false,
 739 | 				terminalPowershellCounter = false,
 740 | 				terminalZdotdir = false,
 741 | 			}) => {
 742 | 				Terminal.setShellIntegrationTimeout(terminalShellIntegrationTimeout)
 743 | 				Terminal.setShellIntegrationDisabled(terminalShellIntegrationDisabled)
 744 | 				Terminal.setCommandDelay(terminalCommandDelay)
 745 | 				Terminal.setTerminalZshClearEolMark(terminalZshClearEolMark)
 746 | 				Terminal.setTerminalZshOhMy(terminalZshOhMy)
 747 | 				Terminal.setTerminalZshP10k(terminalZshP10k)
 748 | 				Terminal.setPowershellCounter(terminalPowershellCounter)
 749 | 				Terminal.setTerminalZdotdir(terminalZdotdir)
 750 | 			},
 751 | 		)
 752 | 
 753 | 		this.getState().then(({ ttsEnabled }) => {
 754 | 			setTtsEnabled(ttsEnabled ?? false)
 755 | 		})
 756 | 
 757 | 		this.getState().then(({ ttsSpeed }) => {
 758 | 			setTtsSpeed(ttsSpeed ?? 1)
 759 | 		})
 760 | 
 761 | 		// Set up webview options with proper resource roots
 762 | 		const resourceRoots = [this.contextProxy.extensionUri]
 763 | 
 764 | 		// Add workspace folders to allow access to workspace files
 765 | 		if (vscode.workspace.workspaceFolders) {
 766 | 			resourceRoots.push(...vscode.workspace.workspaceFolders.map((folder) => folder.uri))
 767 | 		}
 768 | 
 769 | 		webviewView.webview.options = {
 770 | 			enableScripts: true,
 771 | 			localResourceRoots: resourceRoots,
 772 | 		}
 773 | 
 774 | 		webviewView.webview.html =
 775 | 			this.contextProxy.extensionMode === vscode.ExtensionMode.Development
 776 | 				? await this.getHMRHtmlContent(webviewView.webview)
 777 | 				: this.getHtmlContent(webviewView.webview)
 778 | 
 779 | 		// Sets up an event listener to listen for messages passed from the webview view context
 780 | 		// and executes code based on the message that is received.
 781 | 		this.setWebviewMessageListener(webviewView.webview)
 782 | 
 783 | 		// Initialize code index status subscription for the current workspace.
 784 | 		this.updateCodeIndexStatusSubscription()
 785 | 
 786 | 		// Listen for active editor changes to update code index status for the
 787 | 		// current workspace.
 788 | 		const activeEditorSubscription = vscode.window.onDidChangeActiveTextEditor(() => {
 789 | 			// Update subscription when workspace might have changed.
 790 | 			this.updateCodeIndexStatusSubscription()
 791 | 		})
 792 | 		this.webviewDisposables.push(activeEditorSubscription)
 793 | 
 794 | 		// Listen for when the panel becomes visible.
 795 | 		// https://github.com/microsoft/vscode-discussions/discussions/840
 796 | 		if ("onDidChangeViewState" in webviewView) {
 797 | 			// WebviewView and WebviewPanel have all the same properties except
 798 | 			// for this visibility listener panel.
 799 | 			const viewStateDisposable = webviewView.onDidChangeViewState(() => {
 800 | 				if (this.view?.visible) {
 801 | 					this.postMessageToWebview({ type: "action", action: "didBecomeVisible" })
 802 | 				}
 803 | 			})
 804 | 
 805 | 			this.webviewDisposables.push(viewStateDisposable)
 806 | 		} else if ("onDidChangeVisibility" in webviewView) {
 807 | 			// sidebar
 808 | 			const visibilityDisposable = webviewView.onDidChangeVisibility(() => {
 809 | 				if (this.view?.visible) {
 810 | 					this.postMessageToWebview({ type: "action", action: "didBecomeVisible" })
 811 | 				}
 812 | 			})
 813 | 
 814 | 			this.webviewDisposables.push(visibilityDisposable)
 815 | 		}
 816 | 
 817 | 		// Listen for when the view is disposed
 818 | 		// This happens when the user closes the view or when the view is closed programmatically
 819 | 		webviewView.onDidDispose(
 820 | 			async () => {
 821 | 				if (inTabMode) {
 822 | 					this.log("Disposing ClineProvider instance for tab view")
 823 | 					await this.dispose()
 824 | 				} else {
 825 | 					this.log("Clearing webview resources for sidebar view")
 826 | 					this.clearWebviewResources()
 827 | 					// Reset current workspace manager reference when view is disposed
 828 | 					this.codeIndexManager = undefined
 829 | 				}
 830 | 			},
 831 | 			null,
 832 | 			this.disposables,
 833 | 		)
 834 | 
 835 | 		// Listen for when color changes
 836 | 		const configDisposable = vscode.workspace.onDidChangeConfiguration(async (e) => {
 837 | 			if (e && e.affectsConfiguration("workbench.colorTheme")) {
 838 | 				// Sends latest theme name to webview
 839 | 				await this.postMessageToWebview({ type: "theme", text: JSON.stringify(await getTheme()) })
 840 | 			}
 841 | 		})
 842 | 		this.webviewDisposables.push(configDisposable)
 843 | 
 844 | 		// If the extension is starting a new session, clear previous task state.
 845 | 		await this.removeClineFromStack()
 846 | 	}

 848 | 	public async createTaskWithHistoryItem(historyItem: HistoryItem & { rootTask?: Task; parentTask?: Task }) {
 849 | 		await this.removeClineFromStack()
 850 | 
 851 | 		// If the history item has a saved mode, restore it and its associated API configuration.
 852 | 		if (historyItem.mode) {
 853 | 			// Validate that the mode still exists
 854 | 			const customModes = await this.customModesManager.getCustomModes()
 855 | 			const modeExists = getModeBySlug(historyItem.mode, customModes) !== undefined
 856 | 
 857 | 			if (!modeExists) {
 858 | 				// Mode no longer exists, fall back to default mode.
 859 | 				this.log(
 860 | 					`Mode '${historyItem.mode}' from history no longer exists. Falling back to default mode '${defaultModeSlug}'.`,
 861 | 				)
 862 | 				historyItem.mode = defaultModeSlug
 863 | 			}
 864 | 
 865 | 			await this.updateGlobalState("mode", historyItem.mode)
 866 | 
 867 | 			// Load the saved API config for the restored mode if it exists.
 868 | 			const savedConfigId = await this.providerSettingsManager.getModeConfigId(historyItem.mode)
 869 | 			const listApiConfig = await this.providerSettingsManager.listConfig()
 870 | 
 871 | 			// Update listApiConfigMeta first to ensure UI has latest data.
 872 | 			await this.updateGlobalState("listApiConfigMeta", listApiConfig)
 873 | 
 874 | 			// If this mode has a saved config, use it.
 875 | 			if (savedConfigId) {
 876 | 				const profile = listApiConfig.find(({ id }) => id === savedConfigId)
 877 | 
 878 | 				if (profile?.name) {
 879 | 					try {
 880 | 						await this.activateProviderProfile({ name: profile.name })
 881 | 					} catch (error) {
 882 | 						// Log the error but continue with task restoration.
 883 | 						this.log(
 884 | 							`Failed to restore API configuration for mode '${historyItem.mode}': ${
 885 | 								error instanceof Error ? error.message : String(error)
 886 | 							}. Continuing with default configuration.`,
 887 | 						)
 888 | 						// The task will continue with the current/default configuration.
 889 | 					}
 890 | 				}
 891 | 			}
 892 | 		}
 893 | 
 894 | 		const {
 895 | 			apiConfiguration,
 896 | 			diffEnabled: enableDiff,
 897 | 			enableCheckpoints,
 898 | 			fuzzyMatchThreshold,
 899 | 			experiments,
 900 | 			cloudUserInfo,
 901 | 			taskSyncEnabled,
 902 | 		} = await this.getState()
 903 | 
 904 | 		const task = new Task({
 905 | 			provider: this,
 906 | 			apiConfiguration,
 907 | 			enableDiff,
 908 | 			enableCheckpoints,
 909 | 			fuzzyMatchThreshold,
 910 | 			consecutiveMistakeLimit: apiConfiguration.consecutiveMistakeLimit,
 911 | 			historyItem,
 912 | 			experiments,
 913 | 			rootTask: historyItem.rootTask,
 914 | 			parentTask: historyItem.parentTask,
 915 | 			taskNumber: historyItem.number,
 916 | 			workspacePath: historyItem.workspace,
 917 | 			onCreated: this.taskCreationCallback,
 918 | 			enableBridge: BridgeOrchestrator.isEnabled(cloudUserInfo, taskSyncEnabled),
 919 | 		})
 920 | 
 921 | 		await this.addClineToStack(task)
 922 | 
 923 | 		this.log(
 924 | 			`[createTaskWithHistoryItem] ${task.parentTask ? "child" : "parent"} task ${task.taskId}.${task.instanceId} instantiated`,
 925 | 		)
 926 | 
 927 | 		// Check if there's a pending edit after checkpoint restoration
 928 | 		const operationId = `task-${task.taskId}`
 929 | 		const pendingEdit = this.getPendingEditOperation(operationId)
 930 | 		if (pendingEdit) {
 931 | 			this.clearPendingEditOperation(operationId) // Clear the pending edit
 932 | 
 933 | 			this.log(`[createTaskWithHistoryItem] Processing pending edit after checkpoint restoration`)
 934 | 
 935 | 			// Process the pending edit after a short delay to ensure the task is fully initialized
 936 | 			setTimeout(async () => {
 937 | 				try {
 938 | 					// Find the message index in the restored state
 939 | 					const { messageIndex, apiConversationHistoryIndex } = (() => {
 940 | 						const messageIndex = task.clineMessages.findIndex((msg) => msg.ts === pendingEdit.messageTs)
 941 | 						const apiConversationHistoryIndex = task.apiConversationHistory.findIndex(
 942 | 							(msg) => msg.ts === pendingEdit.messageTs,
 943 | 						)
 944 | 						return { messageIndex, apiConversationHistoryIndex }
 945 | 					})()
 946 | 
 947 | 					if (messageIndex !== -1) {
 948 | 						// Remove the target message and all subsequent messages
 949 | 						await task.overwriteClineMessages(task.clineMessages.slice(0, messageIndex))
 950 | 
 951 | 						if (apiConversationHistoryIndex !== -1) {
 952 | 							await task.overwriteApiConversationHistory(
 953 | 								task.apiConversationHistory.slice(0, apiConversationHistoryIndex),
 954 | 							)
 955 | 						}
 956 | 
 957 | 						// Process the edited message
 958 | 						await task.handleWebviewAskResponse(
 959 | 							"messageResponse",
 960 | 							pendingEdit.editedContent,
 961 | 							pendingEdit.images,
 962 | 						)
 963 | 					}
 964 | 				} catch (error) {
 965 | 					this.log(`[createTaskWithHistoryItem] Error processing pending edit: ${error}`)
 966 | 				}
 967 | 			}, 100) // Small delay to ensure task is fully ready
 968 | 		}
 969 | 
 970 | 		return task
 971 | 	}

 973 | 	public async postMessageToWebview(message: ExtensionMessage) {
 974 | 		await this.view?.webview.postMessage(message)

 13 | function getSimilarity(original: string, search: string): number {
 14 | 	// Empty searches are no longer supported
 15 | 	if (search === "") {
 16 | 		return 0
 17 | 	}
 18 | 
 19 | 	// Use the normalizeString utility to handle smart quotes and other special characters
 20 | 	const normalizedOriginal = normalizeString(original)
 21 | 	const normalizedSearch = normalizeString(search)
 22 | 
 23 | 	if (normalizedOriginal === normalizedSearch) {
 24 | 		return 1
 25 | 	}
 26 | 
 27 | 	// Calculate Levenshtein distance using fastest-levenshtein's distance function
 28 | 	const dist = distance(normalizedOriginal, normalizedSearch)
 29 | 
 30 | 	// Calculate similarity ratio (0 to 1, where 1 is an exact match)
 31 | 	const maxLength = Math.max(normalizedOriginal.length, normalizedSearch.length)
 32 | 	return 1 - dist / maxLength
 33 | }

 35 | /**
 36 |  * Performs a "middle-out" search of `lines` (between [startIndex, endIndex]) to find
 37 |  * the slice that is most similar to `searchChunk`. Returns the best score, index, and matched text.
 38 |  */
 39 | function fuzzySearch(lines: string[], searchChunk: string, startIndex: number, endIndex: number) {
 40 | 	let bestScore = 0
 41 | 	let bestMatchIndex = -1
 42 | 	let bestMatchContent = ""
 43 | 	const searchLen = searchChunk.split(/\r?\n/).length
 44 | 
 45 | 	// Middle-out from the midpoint
 46 | 	const midPoint = Math.floor((startIndex + endIndex) / 2)
 47 | 	let leftIndex = midPoint
 48 | 	let rightIndex = midPoint + 1
 49 | 
 50 | 	while (leftIndex >= startIndex || rightIndex <= endIndex - searchLen) {
 51 | 		if (leftIndex >= startIndex) {
 52 | 			const originalChunk = lines.slice(leftIndex, leftIndex + searchLen).join("\n")
 53 | 			const similarity = getSimilarity(originalChunk, searchChunk)
 54 | 			if (similarity > bestScore) {
 55 | 				bestScore = similarity
 56 | 				bestMatchIndex = leftIndex
 57 | 				bestMatchContent = originalChunk
 58 | 			}
 59 | 			leftIndex--
 60 | 		}
 61 | 
 62 | 		if (rightIndex <= endIndex - searchLen) {
 63 | 			const originalChunk = lines.slice(rightIndex, rightIndex + searchLen).join("\n")
 64 | 			const similarity = getSimilarity(originalChunk, searchChunk)
 65 | 			if (similarity > bestScore) {
 66 | 				bestScore = similarity
 67 | 				bestMatchIndex = rightIndex
 68 | 				bestMatchContent = originalChunk
 69 | 			}
 70 | 			rightIndex++
 71 | 		}
 72 | 	}
 73 | 
 74 | 	return { bestScore, bestMatchIndex, bestMatchContent }
 75 | }

139 | 					tool_calls: tool_calls.length > 0 ? tool_calls : undefined,

638 | 	 * @param openFile - Whether to show the file in editor (false = open in memory only for diagnostics)
639 | 	 * @returns Result of the save operation including any new problems detected
640 | 	 */
641 | 	async saveDirectly(
642 | 		relPath: string,
643 | 		content: string,
644 | 		openFile: boolean = true,
645 | 		diagnosticsEnabled: boolean = true,
646 | 		writeDelayMs: number = DEFAULT_WRITE_DELAY_MS,
647 | 	): Promise<{
648 | 		newProblemsMessage: string | undefined
649 | 		userEdits: string | undefined
650 | 		finalContent: string | undefined
651 | 	}> {
652 | 		const absolutePath = path.resolve(this.cwd, relPath)
653 | 
654 | 		// Get diagnostics before editing the file
655 | 		this.preDiagnostics = vscode.languages.getDiagnostics()
656 | 
657 | 		// Write the content directly to the file
658 | 		await createDirectoriesForFile(absolutePath)
659 | 		await fs.writeFile(absolutePath, content, "utf-8")
660 | 
661 | 		// Open the document to ensure diagnostics are loaded
662 | 		// When openFile is false (PREVENT_FOCUS_DISRUPTION enabled), we only open in memory
663 | 		if (openFile) {

665 | 			await vscode.window.showTextDocument(vscode.Uri.file(absolutePath), {

672 |

674 | 			if (doc.isDirty) {
675 | 				await doc.save()
676 | 			}

678 | 			// Force a small delay to ensure diagnostics are triggered
679 | 			await new Promise((resolve) => setTimeout(resolve, 100))
680 | 		}
681 | 
682 | 		let newProblemsMessage = ""
683 | 
684 | 		if (diagnosticsEnabled) {
685 | 			// Add configurable delay to allow linters time to process
686 | 			const safeDelayMs = Math.max(0, writeDelayMs)
687 | 
688 | 			try {
689 | 				await delay(safeDelayMs)
690 | 			} catch (error) {
691 | 				console.warn(`Failed to apply write delay: ${error}`)
692 | 			}
693 | 
694 | 			const postDiagnostics = vscode.languages.getDiagnostics()
695 | 
696 | 			// Get diagnostic settings from state
697 | 			const task = this.taskRef.deref()
698 | 			const state = await task?.providerRef.deref()?.getState()
699 | 			const includeDiagnosticMessages = state?.includeDiagnosticMessages ?? true
700 | 			const maxDiagnosticMessages = state?.maxDiagnosticMessages ?? 50
701 | 
702 | 			const newProblems = await diagnosticsToProblemsString(
703 | 				getNewDiagnostics(this.preDiagnostics, postDiagnostics),
704 | 				[vscode.DiagnosticSeverity.Error],
705 | 				this.cwd,
706 | 				includeDiagnosticMessages,
707 | 				maxDiagnosticMessages,
708 | 			)
709 | 
710 | 			newProblemsMessage =
711 | 				newProblems.length > 0 ? `\n\nNew problems detected after saving the file:\n${newProblems}` : ""
712 | 		}
713 | 
714 | 		// Store the results for formatFileWriteResponse
715 | 		this.newProblemsMessage = newProblemsMessage
716 | 		this.userEdits = undefined
717 | 		this.relPath = relPath
718 | 		this.newContent = content
719 | 
720 | 		return {
721 | 			newProblemsMessage,
722 | 			userEdits: undefined,
723 | 			finalContent: content,
724 | 		}
725 | 	}

349 | 		return result
350 | 	}
351 | 
352 | 	async navigateToUrl(url: string): Promise<BrowserActionResult> {
353 | 		if (!this.browser) {
354 | 			throw new Error("Browser is not launched")
355 | 		}
356 | 		// Remove trailing slash for comparison
357 | 		const normalizedNewUrl = url.replace(/\/$/, "")
358 | 
359 | 		// Extract the root domain from the URL
360 | 		const rootDomain = this.getRootDomain(normalizedNewUrl)
361 | 
362 | 		// Get all current pages
363 | 		const pages = await this.browser.pages()
364 | 
365 | 		// Try to find a page with the same root domain
366 | 		let existingPage: Page | undefined
367 | 
368 | 		for (const page of pages) {
369 | 			try {
370 | 				const pageUrl = page.url()
371 | 				if (pageUrl && this.getRootDomain(pageUrl) === rootDomain) {
372 | 					existingPage = page
373 | 					break
374 | 				}
375 | 			} catch (error) {
376 | 				// Skip pages that might have been closed or have errors
377 | 				console.log(`Error checking page URL: ${error}`)
378 | 				continue
379 | 			}
380 | 		}
381 | 
382 | 		if (existingPage) {
383 | 			// Tab with the same root domain exists, switch to it
384 | 			console.log(`Tab with domain ${rootDomain} already exists, switching to it`)
385 | 
386 | 			// Update the active page
387 | 			this.page = existingPage
388 | 			existingPage.bringToFront()
389 | 
390 | 			// Navigate to the new URL if it's different]
391 | 			const currentUrl = existingPage.url().replace(/\/$/, "") // Remove trailing / if present
392 | 			if (this.getRootDomain(currentUrl) === rootDomain && currentUrl !== normalizedNewUrl) {
393 | 				console.log(`Navigating to new URL: ${normalizedNewUrl}`)
394 | 				console.log(`Current URL: ${currentUrl}`)
395 | 				console.log(`Root domain: ${this.getRootDomain(currentUrl)}`)
396 | 				console.log(`New URL: ${normalizedNewUrl}`)
397 | 				// Navigate to the new URL
398 | 				return this.doAction(async (page) => {
399 | 					await this.navigatePageToUrl(page, normalizedNewUrl)
400 | 				})
401 | 			} else {
402 | 				console.log(`Tab with domain ${rootDomain} already exists, and URL is the same: ${normalizedNewUrl}`)
403 | 				// URL is the same, just reload the page to ensure it's up to date
404 | 				console.log(`Reloading page: ${normalizedNewUrl}`)
405 | 				console.log(`Current URL: ${currentUrl}`)
406 | 				console.log(`Root domain: ${this.getRootDomain(currentUrl)}`)
407 | 				console.log(`New URL: ${normalizedNewUrl}`)
408 | 				return this.doAction(async (page) => {
409 | 					await page.reload({
410 | 						timeout: BROWSER_NAVIGATION_TIMEOUT,
411 | 						waitUntil: ["domcontentloaded", "networkidle2"],
412 | 					})
413 | 					await this.waitTillHTMLStable(page)
414 | 				})
415 | 			}
416 | 		} else {
417 | 			// No tab with this root domain exists, create a new one
418 | 			console.log(`No tab with domain ${rootDomain} exists, creating a new one`)
419 | 			return this.createNewTab(normalizedNewUrl)
420 | 		}
421 | 	}
422 | 
423 | 	// page.goto { waitUntil: "networkidle0" } may not ever resolve, and not waiting could return page content too early before js has loaded
424 | 	// https://stackoverflow.com/questions/52497252/puppeteer-wait-until-page-is-completely-loaded/61304202#61304202
425 | 	private async waitTillHTMLStable(page: Page, timeout = 5_000) {
426 | 		const checkDurationMsecs = 500 // 1000
427 | 		const maxChecks = timeout / checkDurationMsecs
428 | 		let lastHTMLSize = 0
429 | 		let checkCounts = 1
430 | 		let countStableSizeIterations = 0
431 | 		const minStableSizeIterations = 3
432 | 
433 | 		while (checkCounts++ <= maxChecks) {
434 | 			let html = await page.content()
435 | 			let currentHTMLSize = html.length
436 | 
437 | 			// let bodyHTMLSize = await page.evaluate(() => document.body.innerHTML.length)
438 | 			console.log("last: ", lastHTMLSize, " <> curr: ", currentHTMLSize)
439 | 
440 | 			if (lastHTMLSize !== 0 && currentHTMLSize === lastHTMLSize) {
441 | 				countStableSizeIterations++
442 | 			} else {
443 | 				countStableSizeIterations = 0 //reset the counter
444 | 			}
445 | 
446 | 			if (countStableSizeIterations >= minStableSizeIterations) {
447 | 				console.log("Page rendered fully...")
448 | 				break
449 | 			}
450 | 
451 | 			lastHTMLSize = currentHTMLSize
452 | 			await delay(checkDurationMsecs)
453 | 		}
454 | 	}
455 | 
456 | 	/**
457 | 	 * Handles mouse interaction with network activity monitoring
458 | 	 */
459 | 	private async handleMouseInteraction(
460 | 		page: Page,
461 | 		coordinate: string,
462 | 		action: (x: number, y: number) => Promise<void>,
463 | 	): Promise<void> {
464 | 		const [x, y] = coordinate.split(",").map(Number)
465 | 
466 | 		// Set up network request monitoring
467 | 		let hasNetworkActivity = false
468 | 		const requestListener = () => {
469 | 			hasNetworkActivity = true
470 | 		}
471 | 		page.on("request", requestListener)
472 | 
473 | 		// Perform the mouse action
474 | 		await action(x, y)
475 | 		this.currentMousePosition = coordinate
476 | 
477 | 		// Small delay to check if action triggered any network activity
478 | 		await delay(100)
479 | 
480 | 		if (hasNetworkActivity) {
481 | 			// If we detected network activity, wait for navigation/loading
482 | 			await page
483 | 				.waitForNavigation({
484 | 					waitUntil: ["domcontentloaded", "networkidle2"],
485 | 					timeout: BROWSER_NAVIGATION_TIMEOUT,
486 | 				})
487 | 				.catch(() => {})
488 | 			await this.waitTillHTMLStable(page)
489 | 		}
490 | 
491 | 		// Clean up listener
492 | 		page.off("request", requestListener)
493 | 	}
494 | 
495 | 	async click(coordinate: string): Promise<BrowserActionResult> {
496 | 		return this.doAction(async (page) => {
497 | 			await this.handleMouseInteraction(page, coordinate, async (x, y) => {
498 | 				await page.mouse.click(x, y)
499 | 			})
500 | 		})
501 | 	}

503 | 	async type(text: string): Promise<BrowserActionResult> {
504 | 		return this.doAction(async (page) => {
505 | 			await page.keyboard.type(text)
506 | 		})
507 | 	}

510 | 	 * Scrolls the page by the specified amount
511 | 	 */
512 | 	private async scrollPage(page: Page, direction: "up" | "down"): Promise<void> {
513 | 		const { height } = this.getViewport()
514 | 		const scrollAmount = direction === "down" ? height : -height
515 | 
516 | 		await page.evaluate((scrollHeight) => {
517 | 			window.scrollBy({
518 | 				top: scrollHeight,
519 | 				behavior: "auto",
520 | 			})
521 | 		}, scrollAmount)
522 | 
523 | 		await delay(300)
524 | 	}
525 | 
526 | 	async scrollDown(): Promise<BrowserActionResult> {
527 | 		return this.doAction(async (page) => {
528 | 			await this.scrollPage(page, "down")
529 | 		})
530 | 	}
531 | 
532 | 	async scrollUp(): Promise<BrowserActionResult> {
533 | 		return this.doAction(async (page) => {
534 | 			await this.scrollPage(page, "up")
535 | 		})
536 | 	}

538 | 	async hover(coordinate: string): Promise<BrowserActionResult> {
539 | 		return this.doAction(async (page) => {
540 | 			await this.handleMouseInteraction(page, coordinate, async (x, y) => {
541 | 				await page.mouse.move(x, y)
542 | 				// Small delay to allow any hover effects to appear
543 | 				await delay(300)
544 | 			})
545 | 		})
546 | 	}

548 | 	async resize(size: string): Promise<BrowserActionResult> {
549 | 		return this.doAction(async (page) => {
550 | 			const [width, height] = size.split(",").map(Number)
551 | 			const session = await page.createCDPSession()
552 | 			await page.setViewport({ width, height })
553 | 			const { windowId } = await session.send("Browser.getWindowForTarget")
554 | 			await session.send("Browser.setWindowBounds", {
555 | 				bounds: { width, height },
556 | 				windowId,
557 | 			})
558 | 		})
559 | 	}
560 | }
